content.question: The derivative of a function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is given by <math alttext="f prime of x, equals, 0.1 x, plus e raised to the 0.25 x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>â€²</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0.1</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0.25</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. At what value of <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for <math alttext="x greater than 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>></mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> does the line tangent to the graph of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> at <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> have slope 2 ?

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
